sense.name: a curved, two-sided, symmetrical supportive vertical structure that spans an opening
sense.examples: Viaducts are supported by either a series of arches or columns. The keystone of an arch is crucial to its structural stability.

sense.name: any curved symmetrical vertical shape that spans an opening
sense.examples: The arch of his eyebrows indicated his surprise at her appearance. The child drew a black cat with a high arch in its back. The overhanging branches of the trees formed a natural arch in front of the house.

sense.name: a bony support structure of the human foot
sense.examples: The army wouldn't take Bob because of his fallen arches. That ballerina has very high arches. John got a cramp in his arch while swimming.

sense.name: a curved ceremonial monument serving as a passageway
sense.commentary: ARCH[+entity][+artifact][+construction][+vertical][+curved][+symmetrical][+keystone][+spanning][+open_space][+ceremonial][+passageway] Note: a circumscribed usage of Sense 1, denotes a ceremonial purpose and origin.
sense.examples: Our guide pointed out two triumphal arches built by Roman emperors. The triumphant army paraded under a victory arch.
